results.title: After life
results.creator_credit: Hirokazu Kore-eda, Masayuki Akieda, Shiho Satu, Engine Film and TV Man Union
results.brief_description: In a disused schoolhouse somewhere between heaven and earth, the newly dead wait in Limbo. They are greeted by guides who assist them in sifting through their memories to find the one defining moment of their lives that they will carry into eternity. After three days most of the newly dead have chosen their memories which are then mocked-up on a low-tech sound stage and filmed. As they watch the cinematic re-creations of these memories they disappear from Limbo. Kore-eda’s film is both a gentle and heartfelt meditation on remembrance, love and forgiveness, and an investigation into the potent role that cinema plays in the creation, evocation and re-presentation of personal memory. Cast: Arata, Erika Oda, Susumu Terajima, Takashi Naito, Kei Tani. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: After hours
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Robert F. Colesberry, Griffin Dunne, Amy Robinson and The Geffen Company
results.brief_description: Computer expert Paul Hackett accidentally stumbles into an all-night adventure through the rain-soaked streets of SoHo, Manhattan, when a chance evening encounter with a beautiful girl goes wrong. It all begins when his money flies out of a taxi and gets progressively worse from there, as he is led through a nightmarish chain of events. Eventually, his troubles become so horrible and convoluted that it seems he has wandered into a secret antechamber of Hell. All he wants is to get home, but events conspire against him in an hilariously appalling fashion. This nerve-wracking, blackly comic, paranoid nightmare is among Scorsese’s most entertaining and overlooked films. Cast includes Griffin Dunne, Rosanna Arquette, Verna Bloom, Teri Garr, John Heard, Cheech & Chong and a special appearance by Martin Scorsese.

results.title: After hours
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, Australian Film Commission, Women's Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Dramatized situation of an office worker who alleges sexual abuse when asked to stay back late to finish some typing. She loses her job as a result of her claims. Both her fellow workers and boyfriend fail to understand her situation, somehow blaming her for what happened. The investigator for the case finds difficulty in obtaining evidence from people associated with the manager. Cast: Danielle Pearse, Don Reid, Anna-Maria Monticelli, Russell Newman.

results.title: Afrika: Cape Town to Cairo
results.creator_credit: Michael Davie, Ellenor Cox, Marcul Gillezeau and Firelight Productions
results.brief_description: A four part series presented by Michael Davie, a 22-year-old writer and filmmaker who set out to travel from one side of Africa to the other, the notorious 8500km journey from Cape Town to Cairo through dangerous and spectacular surroundings including Johannesburg, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Lake Malawi, Mount Kilimanjaro and Ethiopia. Arrested, beaten and interrogated numerous times on his journey, Michael reached his destination seven months after starting. The parts of the series are: Episode 1: Warriors and Witchdoctors - Michael begins by rediscovering his roots, having left the country as a childhood refugee, before travelling to Johannesburg where he meets Geraldine, a homeless prostitute and discovers the city’s violence firsthand. Episode 2: Home is Where the Landmines Are - Michael hitches to Zimbabwe and is arrested for investigating the lives of street kids before heading to Mozambique where he meets a 5 year old landmine victim and watches her learn to walk again. Episode 3: Slobs in Paradise - Michael travels Lake Malawi and Dar es Salam, investigates the heroin trade in Tanzania and climbs Mount Kilimanjaro. Episode 4: Delinquents, Tribes and Millionaires - Michael searches for the Masai warriors and meets some teenage millionaires in Kenya before sailing up the Nile to Cairo.

results.title: African odyssey: the two worlds of Musembe
results.creator_credit: Albert Waller and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: The two worlds of 11 year-old Musembe are the two worlds of 20th century Africa: the modern city where Musembe and his parents live in a large apartment building, and the primitive village where his civil servant father was born. A journey “home” - back to the family’s village - shows us the natural beauty of Kenya and gives a very human insight into the decisions which confront many Africans today. Musembe feels drawn to the village, and the tribal customs but his father reminds him, “We are city people now”, and we realize the emotional conflicts which come with rapid social change.

results.title: African odyssey: the red bicycle
results.creator_credit: Albert Waller and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: The travels of a red bicycle, assembled in Nairobi, enable us to learn about economic life in Africa, as it passes to a succession of owners. A tribal chief visiting the city buys it for his son and takes it back to his village in the bush. Subsequently, it is acquired by a young farmer, a government coffee tester, some tourists on safari, and eventually returned to the original village, where its parts are broken up and shared by everyone.

results.title: African city: contrasting cultures
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardonyi, Clifford Janoff and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Discusses the great contrasts of culture, life style and economic well being in the African city of Abidjan on the Ivory Coast. Shows the two distinct areas which represent the dichotomy between the poor and the wealthy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Gardonyi, Clifford Janoff and Bailey Film Productions

results.title: Africa alive
results.brief_description: Africa is a continent of mystery and beauty known for the splendour and grandeur of its wildlife which is under threat by poachers decimating the continent’s elephant and rhinoceros populations. “Africa Alive” reveals modern Africa in all its guises; its timeless beauty and its many characters. The expedition travels coastal Africa in a traditional vessel to capture the the soul and spirit of this distinctive land.

The expedition travels coastal Africa in a traditional vessel to capture the the soul and spirit of this distinctive land.

results.title: Africa : village on stilts
results.creator_credit: Denis Hargrave, UNICEF and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Depicts the tribal traditions in a typical fishing village in the Republic of Dahomey, Africa, where the houses are built high on stilts above the water. Features Nicolas an 11 year old boy, as he goes to school, swims, plays and helps his father. Also shows how the piping in of clean drinking water helped reduce the death rate from cholera and other water-borne diseases. Narrated by Percy Rodriguez.

results.title: AFL: I'd like to see that [advertisement] 1996
results.brief_description: Produced in 1996 to commemorate the Centenary of Australian Rules Football this ad features international celebrities John Lee Hooker (musician), Heather Locklear (actress), Archbishop Desmond Tutu (religious leader) and George Burns (comedian). Produced by Campaign Palace.
